text: this is David Robert Mitchell I'm the
writer and director of it follows so
this is the opening shot of the film
we're starting with this sort of slow
kind of calm objective shot of this of
this sort of middle-class neighborhood
and you know we see this girl running in
fear we're not really sure what it is
that she's running from what she's
scared of maybe a play on a bit of a
cliche so some of this right down to the
Wardrobe
is using high heels which I've had some
people sort of point out questioning
does that make a lot of sense and the
answer is no it's probably it's it's
definitely a bit of a play on the
conventions of horror all the way back
to referencing women in peril from even
like De Palma movies for instance you'll
notice throughout this sequence we did
this in it's in one shot it's playing on
this idea of of us being sort of you
know sort of cold or observers of this
terrible thing happening and that we're
on the outside of it
what's the matter what's going on
so it was definitely a tricky shot to do
I think the Sun was setting this was
this was dusk and just running around
and getting the timing right with the
equipment that we had was very tricky
but you know we managed to do it I'm
happy with it it was a it was a fun
thing to try to do
